[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/ability.rs] [Integration: Type signatures] [Signature verification] Type signatures include ability constraints - if ability sets in signatures can be manipulated (e.g., via bytecode patching), could attackers call functions with incorrectly typed arguments that violate safety? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/ability.rs] [Integration: Storage layout] [Global storage schema] When types with Key ability are stored globally, if their ability sets are not re-validated on retrieval, could on-chain data corruption cause invalid types to be loaded from storage? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/ability.rs] [Arithmetic: Ability as u8] [Cast safety] Abilities are cast to u8 via 'as' operator throughout the code - if the enum representation changes or if unsafe code violates repr(u8), could these casts produce unexpected values? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/ability.rs] [Logic: Set operations] [Algebraic properties] Do operations like union, intersect, setminus satisfy expected algebraic properties (commutativity, associativity, distributivity)? Could violations of these properties cause type checking bugs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/ability.rs] [Attack: Storage pollution] [Key bypass] Can an attacker bypass Key ability checks to store arbitrary data structures in global storage, causing state bloat that degrades network performance or violates storage invariants? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/ability.rs] [Attack: Signer duplication] [Signer Copy] Can an attacker exploit ability bugs to copy or store Signer values, allowing them to impersonate other accounts and execute unauthorized transactions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/ability.rs] [Attack: Reference persistence] [Reference Store] Can an attacker store references in global storage by bypassing Store ability checks, causing dangling pointers or memory corruption when references outlive their referents? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/ability.rs] [Attack: Type confusion] [Generic type injection] Can an attacker instantiate Vector<T> where T has incorrect abilities (e.g., T lacks Store but Vector<T> is stored globally), causing type confusion when elements are accessed? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/ability.rs] [Scenario: Nested generics] [Recursive constraints] For deeply nested generics like Vector<Vector<Vector<T>>>, does polymorphic_abilities() correctly propagate constraints through all levels, or could deep nesting cause stack overflow or incorrect ability computation? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/ability.rs] [Scenario: Ability inheritance] [Struct field constraints] When a struct with ability A has fields that need ability A.requires(), if field abilities are not validated, could structs be created with abilities their fields don't support?
